page.title: 09The Port Isaac Lifeboat
page.content: The present lifeboat has been in Port Isaac since 1967 when the Blue Peter progamme collected money, sent it in and bought Port Isaac and other towns a lifeboat.The lifeboat has been out 226 times on rescue missions and it has rescued or saved people 126 times, John's main reason for joining was that he wanted to put something back into the village.He also enjoyed being part of a team and liked the spirit of when they're all working together and the fact that they're doing something good for some one else for a change. Every winter they have a meeting on Monday nights where they all get together and have first aid training raidio,coastal recognition and lots more.They have at least 6 practices at sea in the summer.
